dt: {bc}a literary work designed to reproduce the style of another author
{bc}the repetition by one voice of a melody, phrase, or motive stated earlier in the composition by a different voice
{bc}the quality of an object in possessing some of the nature or attributes of a transcendent idea
{bc}the assumption of behavior observed in other individuals

et: Middle English {it}ymytacyoun{/it} "emulation," borrowed from Middle French & Latin; Middle French {it}imitacion,{/it} borrowed from Latin {it}imitātiōn-, imitātiō{/it} "action of copying, copy," from {it}imitārī{/it} "to follow as a pattern, {et_link|imitate|imitate}" + {it}-tiōn-, -tiō,{/it} suffix of verbal action
shortdef: an act or instance of imitating
something produced as a copy : counterfeit
a literary work designed to reproduce the style of another author

dt: {bc}resembling something else that is usually genuine and of better quality {bc}not real

shortdef: resembling something else that is usually genuine and of better quality : not real

dt.t: The remake of the movie was a {it}pale imitation{/it} of the original.
